description: Display of a single sided, internally illuminated digital screen to the inward face of an existing bus shelter structure (Site H)
decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed advertisement, by virtue of its location, scale, prominence, orientation and method of illumination, would be an incongruous addition resulting in harmful visual clutter, detrimental to the amenity of the streetscene, Hampstead Neighbourhood Area and South End Green designated public open space, and harmful within the settings of nearby listed street furniture and the character and appearance of the adjacent Hampstead Conservation Area located directly opposite, contrary to policies A2 (Open space), D1 (Design), D2 (Heritage) and D4 (Advertisements) of the Camden Local Plan 2017, and DH1 (Design), DH2 (Conservation areas and listed buildings) and DH3 (The urban realm) of the Hampstead Neighbourhood Area Plan 2018.

Reason : 2 - The proposed advertisement, by virtue of its location, scale, prominence, orientation, method of illumination and proximity to a pedestrian crossing, would introduce a distraction to traffic and pedestrians, causing harm to highway and public safety, contrary to Transport for London guidance, and to policies A1 (Managing the Impact of Development), D4 (Advertisements) and T1 (Prioritising walking, cycling and public transport) of the Camden Local Plan 2017, and DH3 (The urban realm) and TT2 (Pedestrian environments) of the Hampstead Neighbourhood Area Plan 2018.
